definition: destruction
to cover/to overflow/to overturn/to capsize
variant of 復|复[fu4]/to reply to a letter
to extinguish or put out/to go out (of a fire etc)/to exterminate or wipe out/to drown

sentences.english: The counter-revolutionary gang was on the rampage for a time, but before long it was completely overthrown.
sentences.chinese: 猖獗一時的反革命匪幫，曾幾何時，遭到了徹底覆滅。

sentences.english: It will eventually succumb to the forces of freedom and progress.
sentences.chinese: 它最終將覆滅於自由與進步的力量。

sentences.english: So stop feeding it and let it wither on the vine.
sentences.chinese: 所以請停止餵養它，儘快讓它覆滅吧。

sentences.english: The complete collapse of the Kuomintang troops in the Northeast then became a foregone conclusion .
sentences.chinese: 此時，東北國民黨軍全軍覆滅的命運，已成定局。

sentences.english: Recurrent slave uprisings brought about the downfall of the ancient roman empire .
sentences.chinese: 不斷出現的奴隸起義導致了古羅馬帝國的覆滅。

sentences.english: Contagion will spread across the euro zone. The end will come soon enough.
sentences.chinese: 恐慌會蔓延到整個歐元區，歐元的覆滅也將隨之而來。

definition: internal trouble and outside aggression (idiom); in a mess both domestically and abroad
peasant revolt
utterly defeated/routed/crushed/to collapse (of army)
dictatorship
to transition to a new dynasty or regime
to engage in wars of aggression at will (idiom)/militaristic/bellicose
tossed about by the wind and rain (idiom)/(of a situation) unstable
ancient country
to break up into components/to disintegrate/to collapse/to crumble
to defect/to betray/to mutiny
fight
to recover one's power or authority/restoration (of a past regime)
the hardships of beginning an undertaking (idiom)
to oppose each other with equal harshness (idiom); tit for tat/measure for measure
to watch with folded arms (idiom); to look on without lifting a finger
prosperity and decline (of a kingdom)/rise and fall
